ingredients.title: Ingredients
ingredients.subtitle: Manage your ingredient inventory and track costs

prompts.add: Fill out the form below to add a new ingredient to your inventory.

archive.title: Archive Ingredient
archive.message: Are you sure you want to archive "{{name}}"? It will be removed from the master list but will remain in existing recipes.

help.name: Enter a descriptive name for this ingredient. This will be used throughout the system for identification.
help.category: Select the primary category this ingredient belongs to. This helps with organization and filtering.
help.currentPrice: The current purchase price for this ingredient from your supplier. This is used to calculate recipe costs.
help.pricePerUnit: The cost per single unit of measure. For example, if you buy in bulk but use smaller portions, this helps calculate exact recipe costs.
help.currency: Select the currency for this ingredient's pricing. This will be converted to your base currency for calculations.
help.unitOfMeasure: The standard unit you use to measure this ingredient (e.g., kg, lbs, liters, pieces).
help.currentStock: The current quantity of this ingredient you have on hand in your inventory.
help.minStockLevel: Set a minimum stock level. You'll be alerted when inventory falls below this amount.
help.supplier: Select the primary supplier for this ingredient. You can add suppliers in the Suppliers section.
help.purchaseUnit: The unit in which you purchase this item (e.g., Case, Pack, Bag).
help.conversionRatio: How many base units are in one purchase unit. For example, if you buy a Case of 12 Bottles, the ratio is 12.

recipes.title: Recipes
recipes.allergensDesc: Mark dietary restrictions and common allergens.

help.name: Enter a memorable name for this recipe. This will appear on your menu and reports.
help.category: Classify this recipe to help with menu organization (e.g., Appetizer, Main Course, Dessert).
help.description: Provide a brief description of this dish. This can be used for menu descriptions or internal notes.
help.servings: Number of portions this recipe produces. Used to calculate per-serving costs.
help.prepTime: Estimated preparation time in minutes. Helps with kitchen scheduling and labor cost calculations.
help.sellingPrice: The menu price for this dish. Used to calculate profit margins.
help.targetCostPercentage: Your ideal food cost as a percentage of selling price (e.g., 30%). The system will alert you if actual costs exceed this.
help.wasteBuffer: Add a percentage to account for ingredient waste, trimming, or spillage (e.g., 5-10%). This ensures more accurate cost calculations.
help.yield: The total quantity this recipe produces (e.g. 5 for 5kg).
help.yieldUnit: The unit for the batch yield (e.g. kg, L, pieces).

recipes.subtitle: Manage your menu items and calculate costs.

inventory.title: Inventory
inventory.subtitle: Manage stock levels and track transactions.

help.transactionType: Choose the type of stock movement: Purchase adds stock, Usage/Waste subtract stock, and Adjustment sets the exact count.
help.quantity: Enter the amount of stock being added, removed, or set. Use the ingredient's base unit of measure.
help.costPerUnit: The price paid per unit for this transaction. For purchases, this updates the ingredient cost. For usage/waste, it's used for reporting.
help.currency: The currency for this transaction's costs. Multi-currency transactions are automatically converted for reporting.
help.reference: Optional reference number or invoice ID for tracking purposes (e.g., supplier invoice numbers).
help.notes: Additional context about this transaction, such as reasons for adjustments or waste.

suppliers.title: Suppliers

help.name: Enter the business name of this supplier. This helps you identify them in orders and reports.
help.contactPerson: The primary person to contact at this supplier for orders and inquiries.
help.email: Supplier's email address for order confirmations and communications.
help.phone: Primary phone number to reach this supplier for urgent matters or order questions.
help.address: Physical or mailing address of the supplier. Useful for delivery tracking and records.
help.paymentTerms: Agreed payment arrangement (e.g., Net 30, COD, or credit terms). Helps with cash flow planning.

suppliers.subtitle: Manage your ingredient sources and contacts.
